div.p: SALOME, widow of Alexander Jannaeus, and queen of Judaea from 79 to 69 b.c. (see Israel, vol xiii. p. 424). Another Salome is the daughter of Herodias mentioned in Matt. xiv. 6. Her father was Herod, son of Herod the Great and Mariamme, and she became successively wife of her fatherâ€™s brother the tetrarch Philip (son of Herod the Great by Cleopatra; see Herod Philip), and of Aristobulus.
